page.title: 01The Fifield Area,Berkshire.
page.content: This is still a mainly rural area. Fifield is the only village but there are scattered dwellings many of which are farms and farm cottages.There are two large mansions, New Lodge and Foliejon Park.A Secondary road and several minor roads serve the area and are linked by numerous bridleways and footpaths.2 bus services pass through part of the area.There are 5 pubs,2 in the village,2 along the Forest Green Road and 1 on the Drift Road.Farming is varied:cereals,fodder crops and vegetables are grown and cattle,pigs, sheep and chickens are reared.Several stables keep horses for riding.There are 2 schools,1 nursing home,1 cricket ground,a village hall and a small chapel.
